clinical_study.brief_title: Mothers With a History of Depression and Their 10-14 Year Old Daughters
clinical_study.official_title: The Neural Correlates of Mood and Cognitive Bias in a Population at Risk for Depression: Maternal Cognitive and Emotional Functioning

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate risk factors associated with depression and how such factors might be transmitted cross-generationally. The investigators are conducting an integrative assessment of emotion regulation and stress reactivity in a group of mothers with and without a history of depression and their daughters.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate risk factors associated with depression and how such factors might be transmitted cross-generationally. We are conducting an integrative assessment of emotion regulation and stress reactivity in a group of mothers with and without a history of depression and their daughters. We use a range of methodologies to evaluate these processes, including self-report measures, information-processing performance, HPA-axis functioning and reactivity, and neural responses to emotional stimuli following exposure to stressful experiences.

primary_outcome.description: participants are interviewed in an 18-month follow-up session

arm_group.description: children at familial risk for depression

intervention.description: there is no intervention for this study

biospec_descr.textblock: All participants are asked to submit saliva samples during their second session using sterile salivette containers in order to assess cortisol levels. There is no risk involved in giving these samples.

study_pop.textblock: Eligible mothers must read and speak English fluently and have a child between the ages of 9 and 15 years old. Mothers must either have no history of psychopathology or have a history of depression during their child's lifetime.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Eligible mothers must read and speak English fluently and have a child between the ages of 9 and 15 years old.
- Mothers must either have no history of psychopathology or have a history of depression during their child's lifetime.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Eligible mothers cannot:
- currently be in treatment for drug or alcohol abuse
- have significant symptomatology related to psychopathology outside of depression
- have a medical history of neurological injury or impairment.
- Mothers who meet the requirements for inclusion in the control group must not have a history of any Axis I disorder.
